column4: How do I find the file responsible for a certain pid, as in what is the command line to use?
and if you want to see what process is using a particular file, use lsof
is this normal, how do I terminate this?:5458  0.0  0.0      0     0 ?        Z    09:26   0:00 [sci] <defunct>
if it's really naughty and won't die, kill -9 5458
i forget... does the Z indicate zombie process?
its a defunct / zombie, i tried kill -9 but no go, it keeps coming back after reboot, i'm trying to find the responsible application that's causing it...
not sure what to tell you... check /etc/init.d?
that it is... you could start selectively turning things off until your zombie process goes away
is it the same PID every time?
